SEARCH
Package beans

Class BudgetBean

java.lang.Object
beans.BudgetBean
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
@Named @SessionScoped public class BudgetBean extends Object implements Serializable
BudgetBean is a managed bean that handles budget-related operations for a user, including setting total budgets, category budgets, and retrieving spent amounts.
Author:
xromang00
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • setBudget

      public String setBudget()
      Sets the total budget for the current user.
      Returns:
      null if successful, or an error message if the budget is invalid.

    • setCategoryBudget

      public String setCategoryBudget()
      Sets the budget for a specific category for the current user.
      Returns:
      null if successful, or an error message if the category amount is invalid.

    • getRemainingBudget

      public double getRemainingBudget(Long userId)
      Calculates the remaining budget for the current user.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to calculate the budget for.
      Returns:
      the remaining budget amount.

    • getTotalSpent

      public double getTotalSpent(Long userId)
      Retrieves the total amount spent by the current user for the current month.
      Parameters:
      userId - the ID of the user to calculate the total spent amount for.
      Returns:
      the total spent amount.

    • addMessage

      private void addMessage(jakarta.faces.application.FacesMessage.Severity severity, String summary, String detail)
      Adds a message to the FacesContext for user feedback.
      Parameters:
      severity - the severity level of the message.
      summary - a brief summary of the message.
      detail - detailed information about the message.

    • getCategories

      public String[] getCategories()
      Gets the available categories.
      Returns:
      an array of category names.

    • getCategoryBudgets

      public Map<String,Double> getCategoryBudgets()
      Gets the budgets for each category.
      Returns:
      a map of category names to budget amounts.

    • init

      @PostConstruct public void init()
      Initializes the bean by loading the user's existing budgets. This method is called after the bean is constructed. It retrieves the budgets for the current user and stores them in a map. If the user is not logged in, the map will be empty. If the user has no budgets set, the map will be empty.

    • getCategorySpent

      public double getCategorySpent(String category)
      Retrieves the amount spent in a specific category for the current month. If the user is not logged in, or an error occurs, 0.0 is returned. if the category is not found, 0.0 is returned.
      Parameters:
      category - the category to check.
      Returns:
      the amount spent in the specified category.

    • getTotalBudget

      public double getTotalBudget()
      Gets the total budget.
      Returns:
      the total budget.

    • getSelectedCategory

      public String getSelectedCategory()
      Gets the selected category.
      Returns:
      the selected category.

    • setSelectedCategory

      public void setSelectedCategory(String selectedCategory)
      Sets the selected category.
      Parameters:
      selectedCategory - the category to set.

    • getCategoryAmount

      public double getCategoryAmount()
      Gets the category amount.
      Returns:

      Parameters:
